text: thanks <@U026PLK4S>!
just received the arabic font this morning and forwarded to <@U02618EV1>
Thanks. Just to confirm, this is for the project names on project pages, correct?
yes!
also, dumb question for you Gaston, what size should this website “press” image be. Do you have a preference?
Do you mean the images at the top of the project pages?

Ah, sorry. In the answers to the questions that were posted yesterday, they want a “press photo” for the site in general. So if someone shares the site (say from the homepage), they don’t want to single out one single project, so they’re asking us to create a .jpg that says “ADPP”. Just wondering how big / small I should be making it.
Ah, the open graph image. There was a link with the specs on that email I sent. Looking for it now ...
<http://thenextweb.com/socialmedia/2015/03/24/the-mega-guide-to-ideal-image-sizes-for-your-social-media-posts/>

attachments.title: A Guide to Ideal Image Sizes for Your Social Media Posts
attachments.text: Do you the know the difference between image sizes on Facebook compared to Twitter? Everything you could ever possibly need to know in this guide

text: thanks gaston!

Made a landscape one and a square one, not sure if you’ll be able to use both, but we can test each when you’re ready to see what we like best. They’re on the design folder on the NAS, in a Social Share Image directory.
Excellent. Thanks!
Will try landscape first and we can go from there.

i’m sure that will be fine, the only thing that made me nervous was this thumbnail crop:
<https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/spa/5rar3xay44yc491/7xh79tzv.png>

you mean markdown?

probably not headlines and lists...
I what sections?
hm, its been a while since i peeked at the magnum cms… gimme a sec
but off the top of my head i would think description and artist bio
Project Summary / Captions / Artist Bio….to be safe.

attachments.title: Arab Documentary Photography Program
attachments.text: Arab Documentary Photography Project (ADPP) is an initiative that provides support and mentorship to photographers from across the Arab region. The Arab Fund for Arts and Culture in partnership with Magnum Foundation and the Prince Claus Fund established the ADPP to stimulate compelling work by Arab Photographers working across a range of experimental styles of storytelling.
